docs.snippet: In accusing soccer federation leaders of tarnishing the sport by taking $150 million in bribes and payoffs, U.S. prosecutors laid out a sweeping corruption case that hinges on the testimony of insiders, including some who have agreed to cooperate ...
docs.lead_paragraph: In accusing soccer federation leaders of tarnishing the sport by taking $150 million in bribes and payoffs, U.S. prosecutors laid out a sweeping corruption case that hinges on the testimony of insiders, including some who have agreed to cooperate in plea deals.

headline.main: $150M in Bribes, Dozen Schemes: US Prosecutors' FIFA Case
headline.print_headline: $150M in Bribes, Dozen Schemes: US Prosecutors' FIFA Case

docs.snippet: A fugitive former Los Angeles police officer charged with killing a man during an off-duty fight has been deported back to the U.S. after his arrest in northern Mexico....
docs.lead_paragraph: A fugitive former Los Angeles police officer charged with killing a man during an off-duty fight has been deported back to the U.S. after his arrest in northern Mexico.

headline.main: Ex-LAPD Officer Wanted in Killing Was Lying Low in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Ex-LAPD Officer Wanted in Killing Was Lying Low in Mexico

docs.snippet: The Cleveland police department has agreed to follow some of the most exacting standards in the nation over how and when its officers can use force, part of a settlement with the Justice Department....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cleveland police department has agreed to follow some of the most exacting standards in the nation over how and when its officers can use force, part of a settlement with the Justice Department.
docs.abstract: Officials say Cleveland police department has agreed to adhere to some of most stringent standards in country over how and when its officers can use force, and will allow Justice Dept overview to ensure rules are not ignored; city's police department has become associated with racially charged debate over police tactics.

headline.main: Police in Cleveland Accept Tough Standards on Force
headline.print_headline: Police in Cleveland Accept Tough Standards on Force

byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Cleveland, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Rodney Bengston contributed reporting from Cleveland.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and MATT APUZZO
